text: Characterization of the murine cyclin - dependent kinase inhibitor gene <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The cyclin - dependent kinase inhibitor <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays an important role in regulating cell-cycle progression .

<extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> directly inhibits the catalytic activity of cyclin / cdks ( cyclin - dependent kinase ) complexes and / or interferes physically with cyclin / cdks activation by CAK .
Interestingly , the expression level of <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was maximal in resting Go T-cells and rapidly declined following anti-CD3 activation .

text: We report here the cloning of <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene from murine genomic DNA and the functional analysis of the promoter of the <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
The gene consists of at least three exons and spans more than 5.6 kb of DNA .
Primer extension and nuclease S1 protection analysis revealed two major transcription initiation sites .

The promoter region lacked a TATA box but contained potential binding sites for the transcriptional factors including two <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , CRE , <extra_id_0> Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NFkB located at positions -153 , -178 , -286 , -875 , and -1011 , respectively .
To analyze the regulatory mechanisms controlling <extra_id_0> p27Kip1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression , we characterized the 5'-flanking region from nt -1609 to +178 .
